Reviews.Title: “Good small hotel near Termini, great value”
Reviews.Author: irishtourerIreland
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel, clean, lovely staff, great price compared with similar hotels. Noise: yes, especially if you are near reception however it only woke me when I was about to wake anyways. Bathroom was lovely and modern. Breakfast was actually fresh and nice, not massive i.e. no cheese or ham but croissants were very fresh and lady in charge was very nice. Book table in advance and there was no queue. Free wifi worked no problem and there were 2 laptops if you had no ipad etc. Its on 3rd floor so no noise if windows closed. apparently aircon is extra. Staff are all very nice, no problems and always a smile. In room safe worked great, TV was a bit fiddly however. Plenty of space in the rooms and daily cleaning was spot on. Room had a fridge also but it could have done with a clean inside however I suspect cleaning staff aren't going to look into fridge every time. Termini is alright area, most people seem to stay there. It seems rough but i found it very safe walking around. Get a daily metro ticket for €4, covers metro and bus and tram. Head to vatican early to avoid queues and don't bother with any of the unofficial tours, its as easy on your own

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: GINA H
Reviews.Content: Our flight was canceled in Frankfurt and we had to take a later one into Rome therefore missing our Alitalia connection. It was 8pm and after a flight across from the US we were exhausted and frustrated. The Orlando found us a room and gave me directions after taking the Leonardo Express from FCO. The manager on duty that evening Feb 22 couldn't have been more helpful. Helped us with our bags and getting on the internet so we could let everyone at home know we had arrived that far. They have a lift right to their door and a nice little breakfast one floor up in the morning before catching the train south. We were in a pinch and they bailed us out. Thank you Hotel Orlanda!

Reviews.Title: “Awesomeness and a must for anniversaries!”
Reviews.Author: cbauzon
Reviews.Content: This is my first time writing a review and it's definitely worst writing about. Our room here was probably the biggest compared to our rooms in London, UK and Paris, France. It can compare to rooms in California I would say but all in tiles, no carpet. The second night we stayed the manager and staff had given us a bottle of champaign. Hubby was very impressed! It was chilled and tasted great! We ate every morning and had to book our time between 730-10am with 30 min increments. Enough tables and awesome service in the breakfast room. Every time we left the hotel we gave our room key to the front desk and it was trustworthy. The third night we stayed the hotel staff laid out a paper on marriage with a "Roma" magnet on our nicely made bed! Another awesomeness provided by the staff of hotel Orlanda! Thank you for an amazing experience and we appreciate the priceless gesture of celebration! Til we meet again .... Salute- The DeGuzmans!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean”
Reviews.Author: Giraffe50
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in a quad room in Sept 2011. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the rooms which were clean, bright and comfortable. Location near to Termini station means that there is a fair amount of traffic noise late at night and in the early hours of the morning. Closing the windows solves this problem but be aware that there is a daily extra charge for air conditioning. The hotel is located on the 3rd floor of an old building with a small lift (max capacity 2 people or 1 with luggage) so not ideally suited for pushchairs or wheelchairs.Breakfast was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Italy Vs England”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: This was a very convenient stopover for the game at the Olympic Stadium. The only draw back was that it is 3 floors up and the lift only took one person and a couple of bags at a time. Desk staff were very friendly and all spoke very good English. the room was very spacious and the bed was very comfortable. Continental breakfast was "spartan" but adequate. Ideally located 5 mins from the main termini. I personally would not want to stop more than a few days, but when in Rome ...............

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some not-so-good, but ok for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: 4hersheybear
Reviews.Content: We "upgraded" our Rome hotel in a package to the Hotel Orlanda. The good: Free wifi!! Very nice front desk staff Location convenient - near termini but not TOO near. $8-10E taxi to get to Vatican city. The beds - temperpedic style- were really comfortable The bad: Old hotel, elevator not always operational The ugly: Continental breakfast - just skip it. Stale rolls/pastries. Bring some protein bars or go next door to the little tabaqui/cafe. This was fine for a few nights - we weren't there much anyway. If the price is right...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: Mindyla
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our 3 night stay at Hotel Orlanda in late November. It is walking distance to Termini Station which was important to us and we felt safe in the neighborhood, although we were back in the room by 7PM each night. Room was very basic, clean, and met our needs.Breakfast was very good and pastries were very fresh. Free computer use was a plus. Staff very friendly and helpful. They go the extra mile. When we planned on leaving the room one morning prior to breakfast hours, staff arranged to have our breakfast sent to our room early which was very much appreciated. There is a laundromat a few steps away from the hotel. Price was right!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisP18
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms have a nice size and were very clean. Breakfast was good with all the dolci that were being offered. The hotel is situated ideally for those who don't mind taking the metro to the city center or other touristic spots. And if you have to catch a plane early in the morning there is no better place to stay. I would definitely come back to this hotel if I would make another short visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: LWGandM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Orlanda for 2 nights late October and 3 nights early November. I chose it as I wanted a hotel within walking distance to the main train station (Termini). After reading the reviews, I booked a room directly with the hotel. This is an easy 3 or so block walk. The hotel doesn't have a large sign outside (wish I'd taken a picture to show), but if you look for the street address, no problem. I had two different rooms, both exceptionally clean and comfortable. Breakfast is on the 5th floor and consists of basic breakfast items (cereals, yogurt, milk, juice, roll, croissant, jam, pate...). I read reviews that some people weren't happy with the breakfast options. However, understand Italians usually have a coffee/cappuccino and a croissant or some such pastry. They have free Wifi and two computers for guest use. This was an essential item for me! The first stay it didn't work in my room but did in the main area (even though the front desk person rest it) so I just did what I needed there. the second stay it worked great in my room. Staff all speak great English and are very helpful. Great restaurant suggestions, etc. I would definitely stay here again. As a single woman traveling, I felt very safe and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: La_Butte
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a couple blocks from the Termini train station. We arrived in the evening by train the night before we were flying out, so it was a good location for us. It was clean and had nice rooms. The breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Okay overall”
Reviews.Author: pomaikai
Reviews.Content: Do not let them put you in room 506. You will hear the restaurant downstairs dish-slamming marathon until about 2am. When that finally stops, you'll hear the breakfast room getting ready for the hordes of loud, rude people having breakfast in the hotel. A German women even yelled at me to go get more cups when I came out of the room, not realizing that it was an actual hotel room! Signs might help. Not sure why this is even a guest room...would be better off as a storage space or secondary dining space. The staff was great though, offered to change our rooms when we complained about the noise. Very helpful and full of knowledge about the surrounding area. Very accomodating for whatever we neeeded. Printed our boarding passes for us too. The room was HUGE by European standards. Cleaning service was perfect! For the location - very convenient to Termini, walking distance to many attractions. However, I would not have felt safe walking by myself at night. The people lurking on the streets around the hotel were very unappealing but I felt safe with the hotel security. Overall, I wouldn't stay here again. The hotel itself was okay, but the area was very dirty, full of unsavory people, and too loud for a relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Simply good”
Reviews.Author: Koel2009
Reviews.Content: Great location, not a slums street as might be thought by being so close to termini station. Staff are excellent, nice and helpful. Room is clean and as described, great value for a 2-3 star hotel, has everything you need for a nice stay. There is free wifi even in the room, and there are even two laptops in the lobby to be used by the guests.

Reviews.Title: “They charge 5 euros for air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: flojoflojo1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Orlanda was fine, and we loved the free internet. However, they charged us 5 euros for air conditioning when it was supposed to come free with the room. We forked over the money because it was 90 degrees, but didn't appreciate it. Room was clean. Location was great. Value was good. But they really ticked us off about the air.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: jrissman
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Orlanda with a friend in May 2011. We were satisfied. The hotel is on the third floor of a building containing a couple other hotels. The hotel itself had small, simple, clean rooms. The street outside was filled with cafes and had very little traffic. We had no problems with noise. It was easy to go outside and get a hot chocolate and a pastry for breakfast. If you walk two blocks north, you reach Termini, the main rail hub. There, you can catch busses, the subway, or the inter-city trains. Note that air conditioning costs a few euros extra per night. To get to the hotel, you must either climb two flights of stairs or squeeze into a tiny elevator, which cannot hold more than one person at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ok room”
Reviews.Author: Sims3
Reviews.Content: Hotel was 5 min walk from the train station and you can walk to the Coliseum and many other attractions. Easy access to buses and subways to all other attractions. Hotel was clean. Lots of stairs and one small elevator (1 person and 1 bag or 2 people). Noisy room. We were right across from the room they serve breakfast in. So at 6:30ish the noise started and didn't stop until 10am. Not sure if all the rooms are that noisy or if we just got lucky. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money, awesome hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: AHSCapeTown
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the city centre, about 5 minutes away from the metro. It's close to anything and everything you would need!!! The staff were really great. They gave us useful tips and information. The rooms were clean, neat and very spacious!!! I loved this hotel!!! I will definitely stay at this hotel again!!! 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and great central location!”
Reviews.Author: hapyydays
Reviews.Content: If you want a cheap and cheerful no frills hotel that's centrally located with clean rooms, hot shower and comfy bed then this 2* hotel is perfect. The hotel staff were very friendly and knowledgeable of the area. The hotel is just 5mins away from the Termini station, the area is bustling with lots of places to eat and shop but be aware of gypsies and pick pockets and lots of homeless people which makes the area a bit run down. Rooms were very spacious and clean with air con which is much needed in the 33c heat! There was a fridge but was broken and had empty bottles inside so couldn't be used. Bathroom was clean with hair dryer, had a small TV with BBC World the only English channel. Breakfast was included but disappointing, milk was warm, not much only 2 types of cereal, orange juice that tasted weird and some pastries. Overall good value for money and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Yinhan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Orlanda for 2 nights with another couple. Rooms were clean, basic and functional. I'd say was an above average 2 star. Could quite easily have been a 3 star. Inside the rooms were a safe, fridge, remote controlled air con and a hairdryer. Breakfast was rather limited to bread rolls, cornflakes, muesli, croissants, crackers, juices (tasted like squash) and tea, coffee etc. It was alright. Service - impeccable. ALL staff were courteous, friendly and very helpful. 10 out of 10. Location. 5 to 10 minute walk from Termini so very central. Area not the best but perfect as a base to explore the city. Colosseum was only a 20-25 minute walk from the hotel. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: HydroPuddle
Reviews.Content: Great for a weekend stay considering the price - location is fantastic (a stones throw from the station). Family room great, receptionist could not have been more helpful, especially with booking trains etc. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: Calla12345
Reviews.Content: The location is great, just 5 minutes walk from the main train station. The room is small but acceptable. It is a bit nosiy as there are some restaurants downstairs. The bathroom and breakfast are ok. Considering the relatively low price it charges, I think the hotel is good for money. The staff are nice and helpful, especially the gentleman on night shift. Two computers are provided in the common area for use by guests.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, Cosy, great location!”
Reviews.Author: andy19pandy82
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, clean, comfy bed, frienly staff. If you want space this place isn't for you, but if you want somewhere to rest after exploring this amazing city then Orlanda is for you. I read reviews about it being noisy. I went to bed at about 8 pm (jet lag) local time with the iPod in & didn't wake up once! Bathroom is small but really what do u want? You only need. Shower, sink & toilet! I will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Family Quad Room!!!”
Reviews.Author: DrDebi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 16 and 13 year old sons for one night when we had a very early morning flight out the next morning. Finding a quad room in Rome, for a semi-reasonable price, is a challenge! We wanted one for this one night close to Termini so when we arrived from Sorrento we could easily walk to it with our luggage (took us maybe 3 minutes). It would also be an easy walk back to Termini to catch the Fiumcino Express train, though we used RomeCabs for a private transfer since we needed to be picked up at 3:30 a.m. for a 6 a.m. flight. Hotel Orlanda exactly fit the bill!!!! Good price, large quad room, twin beds for the kids, super nice staff, clean and comfortable. The quad room we had looked EXACTLY like the photos on their website. The room was great. It is a corner room, so you have a window facing out 2 sides of the building, which makes the room bright AND gives you good airflow. It is on the 5th floor (Room 503) so you are quite a ways above the street noise. With the windows open in the day, this is admittedly a noisy area of town and you still get street noise. The windows are good, though, and with them closed the street noise was very, very minimal (not a problem at all). The room was large, and by Roman standards was VERY large (take a look at the photos on their website and you'll see the dimensions). The bathroom is also very large by European standards and would even be considered a good size in North America (I would say the size of a bathroom in a Holiday Inn Express in the USA). We walked in with our 4 pieces of luggage and had everything every which way (it was the last day of a long trip) and there was still PLENTY of room in the room. There is a blowdryer on the wall in the bathroom. The finishes in the bathroom were VERY nice, and the rest of the room was nice with tile floors and nice wallpaper. Hot water was plentiful (ah, such a joy after staying places where it wasn't) and the shower had excellent water pressure. Everything was absolutely spic and span clean! There was a large t.v. (not flat screen) with English language channels (the first we had encountered in 10 days, so my teenagers spent the first hour after check-in happily lounged on their beds watching something or another). My boys were EXTREMELY happy to have the 2 twin beds. There was also a futon type of chair in the room that looked to make out into a 3rd twin sized bed, though we didn't try it and I think it would be most appropriate for a younger child. All the beds were perfectly comfortable. The staff was great. When we straggled in after getting off the very hot train from Naples they gave us 2 bottles of iced tea for free and also pointed me to the coffee machine (free espressos, cappucinos, coffee, lattes....). There is a little cooler in the room behind the front desk where they sell pops/waters/drinks for a very reasonable price and you just pay at the front desk. When they heard we were leaving basically in the middle of the night, they brought up breakfast for us on a tray in the evening so it would be ready for us. Toast, muffins, jellies, butter, honey, yogurts, juices.....it was a very sweet gesture and one that I wasn't expecting at all. All the staff just gave off a good vibe. Nice folks. And we were there for less than 12 hours! There is wifi available for free (we were on the 5th floor and reception was iffy, but you can walk down to the 3rd floor lobby and make yourself comfortable). They also had 2 laptops set up in the room behind the front desk (where the coffee machine is, yippee!) and that made checking in for our flight the next door so much more manageable than trying to do it on my smartphone. The laptops were MUCH appreciated!!!! The laptops had Italian keyboards, and the staff was very sweet as I kept walking out to ask for help "Can I borrow a pen?" "How do I make the @ sign on this keyboard?" We had a wake-up call that was spot-on in time. The area....I was prepared for a dismal, crime-ridden area, but was delighted that the actual street it is on is actually quite cute with lots of sidewalk cafes (even in early April) and it was HOPPING with tourists from all the adjacent hotels until late at night. It felt very safe, which I wasn't expecting. There is a yummy bar/coffee shop a few shops down where I got my nightly fix of pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in Rome”
Reviews.Author: rja730
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Oralnda for 2 nights. The hotel is situated very near to the Termini station about a 5 minute walk to/from. The hotel has a small lift which can eithe fit 2 people no luggage or 1 person / 1 luggage. This is nice to have if you have luggage. The hotel service and staff were great, check in was simple and convenient. The hotel rooms were not bad, the wall paper in our room was peeled off in various spots and some dents but the rooms were clean and made daily. Breakfast was OK, bread/pastries with jams and butter, instant coffee and juice. Its somethig to start your day with. You have to reserve your breakfast slot for the next morning in 1/2 hr intervals. I am guessing due to the small dining room area. Free Wifi was also available. There are other hotels in the same building and around, we chose it for its price point at the time of staying which was a bit cheaper than neighboring hotels. The area felt very safe and has a good dining scene. There are so many restaraunts around, just choose which one. I would recommend this hotel for its great location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the train terminal and affordable but I do not think I will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Anita19111493
Reviews.Content: Pros: Close to the train terminal, affordable, big bathroom (a treat in Italy), nice sized rooms. Cons: It is on the second or third floor of a building so you have to get on the elevator to get to the hotel, the elevator is really small (only one person and one piece of luggage at a time) and the quilt smelled musty. Everything else was clean, but I cannot sleep well with a musty quilt.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff, and free wifi”
Reviews.Author: innocent_smirf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and had an excellent time. The hotel reception is on the third floor but the lift is big enough for luggage. The staff were very friendly and helpful, providing maps and details of local sights and buses. Most of the main sights are within a 20-30 min walk or the bus station is nearby to reach the Vatican. There are also plenty of nice local restaurants and cafes nearby. The free wifi in the hotel is very helpful and there are laptops available to use if you need. Breakfast was included and was simple but tasty. I would highly recommend this hotel for a city trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased”
Reviews.Author: DrEleanora
Reviews.Content: The Orlanda was clean and comfortable, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and the hotel was conveniently located close to the Termini, with a direct train line to the airport, as well as the subway system and buses, for easy access to all the sights in Rome. Lots of close-by bakeries and restaurants. It's not ultra-fancy, but clean, affordable and practical for people who plan to spend most of their time sight-seeing around Rome rather than lounging in the room all day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location- Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: kinmn
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for the cost. Conveniently located close to many restaurants and to the Termini. My husband and I walked to all the attractions except for Vatican City (could have walked- chose not to). Room was very clean and spacious, especially for European standards. Staff was friendly and helpful. Only downside was the noise level from the courtyard and street as the hotel is in a bustling area.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive very nice hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: EMG53
Reviews.Content: Hotel Orlanda is a very nice hotel only two short blocks from Termini. The room we had was large by Europe standards and we had a queen size bed. Everything was clean and simply furnished. It is on the third floor of a building with other hotels. The elevator is very small but it worked fine. Breakfast was a contentail breakfast with great crossants. The shower is very small and a large person might not fit. There is a laundrymat next door and several resturants nearby. We loved it for the price and location and would definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bluebonzoid
Reviews.Content: The key to this hotel is location. It's two blocks away from the Termini station. Every day I would make the short walk to the station to get to any place I wanted to go. At night, I would stop for dinner in the many restaurants in the neighborhood before heading up for the night. The area around the hotel was busy with diners and other hotel patrons, so I was never worried about the neighborhood. I was there 5 days, and the various people behind the desk were very helpful getting me directions to the various sights. The room was nice, clean, and comfortable. It is on the third floor, but a small elevator helps out there.

Reviews.Title: “Value and location”
Reviews.Author: Erichero
Reviews.Content: Hotel Orlanda is simple. It's got the basics you need and does them well. We shared the quadruple room, which was spacious, clean and newly renovated in a simple but clean style. The reception was efficient and helpful, although the staff were new and couldn't recommend much regarding the local area, although they threw in a free map. Free wifi included although ours wasn't working. We chose the hotel because it was only two blocks from the central station. As such, you're close to the metros, close to the main trains and close to the airport transfer services (we used SIT Bus which was fine at 8 euros). Generally the attractions are spaced far apart so access to the metros with a 4 euro day pass can shuttle you around quickly using the A and B lines (you can also use buses). The location is right in the tourist zone with a zillion other hotels, so ignore comments on the area being dirty or typical of train stations, it's not true - Rome was clean in our experience. We'd definitely recommend this place based on value and keeping your budget tight (since everything else in Rome is pricey if you stick to the tourist areas). The lift works but is a bit rickety. Email communications were also excellent. Breakfast is included and the coffee machine is available for free at all times. Television has a limited set of channels including BBC. Security is good, including a safe in the room and controlled access.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideal location for central station”
Reviews.Author: ppmoore
Reviews.Content: The hotel is idelaly located just 100m from the Termini central station. The hotel itself is located on the thid and fifth floors of an old appartment block. Staff were very helpful. Hotel room was very quiet wit the window closed. Breakfast is simple, continental style. The use of the airco was an extra €5 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel near Termini”
Reviews.Author: john070171
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little budget hotel close to Termini that is perfect for a short stay if you are planning on hopping on an early-morning train like we did. The room is comfortable, outside street noise in our room was very loud, but I think that's just a function of the neighborhood around Termini, which can be a bit seedy in parts. We skipped breakfast because we left so early, so can't comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value. Great location”
Reviews.Author: DerekEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: This must be one of the best value hotels in central Rome. Rooms and bathrooms were very clean. Staff spoke good English and couldn't be more helpful. Breakfasts were reasonable. 5 minute walk from station

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good location”
Reviews.Author: June_Beth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights on a budget tour purchased through "go-today.com." The room was clean, we looked over a street which was not a main street so noise was reasonable. The hotel is on the third floor (some Rome oddity, budget hotels typically have one floor of a building (odd, hey?)). Most of the staff spoke good English and were very helpful. Made reservations and looked up phone numbers for us. Room was clean, bathroom was clean (that was important). The breakfast was horrible, but I knew for this money I wouldn't be getting croissants and espresso.; The owner (its' a family run business) stated that they were in the midst of getting an espresso machine so maybe that will change but, wouldn't count on it. All in all, great value for a budget hotel and good location. Recommended. June Jensen

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel. Central location, good amenities.”
Reviews.Author: TMPM75
Reviews.Content: Usually it's wise not to expect much of a hotel near a train station, but we were very pleasantly surprised when we saw our room, which was comfortable and very clean. The location is not upscale--more working class--but we never felt unsafe, and we loved being close to everything. We could walk to many attractions, and the Metro was also close, which was nice. The shower was small (as Italian showers in budget hotels tend to be), but the bathroom was clean, private, and had soap and shampoo (which we definitely did not find everywhere). The water pressure in the shower left something to be desired but was ok. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was reasonable for a budget hotel: a buffet with a pushbutton cappuccino/hot chocolate machine, juice, yoghurt, custard pastries, processed cheese, liver spread. Upon leaving we noticed that there was actually a mini-fridge in the room. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Splendid!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: arizona_8
Reviews.Content: This was the last hotel that we stayed in over a 10 day trip to Italy and what a refreshment! I wish we could have stayed in this hotel the entire time. The staff was amazing! So helpful with directions and information on the area, especially the guy that works at night and early in the morning. I'm sad that I didn't get his name. He was great! The room was large, the bathroom was nice with great hot water in the shower. The breakfast was sufficient with a choice of coffee, cappuchino or tea, crossoints, toast and yougurt. Loved this place!!!! Highly recommend it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quite value for money but breakfast is so so !”
Reviews.Author: Paradise100
Reviews.Content: I travelled Italy with husband this October for almost 2 weeks, and we stayed at this hotel during the stay in Rome. In terms of cleanliness and spacious, the room was great. We lived at 5/F and the hotel located along the main street, so you could be wake up by train or bus in the early morning but it was acceptable to us. Re location, it was about 5-8 mins walk from the Roma Terminus station. Overall, I found the hotel was OK but the breakfast sounds so so when I compared with other hotels. If the room rate is around EURO 70, I would stay there again for my next visit. Also, it had several good restaurants along the street.

Reviews.Title: “good location but bad service of the staff during breakfast time”
Reviews.Author: HLstephanie
Reviews.Content: it is the first time i go to rome with my family. the location is good, near the the station, and reasonable price. that's why i chosen this hotel. v surprise to get the 'roma pass' if booking for 3 nights... very useful. it is so good we can online by using the notebook which provided in hotel. :> while we really don't like the staff in the dining room. blunt affect, poor service indeed.... 'our culture= won't talk during breakfast time??' we really wonder

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: thevalkyrie12
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room at the Pensione Orlanda after a recommendation from a family member. Well the reception staff was very pleasant. Our room was very clean, and the linen and towels were intact. The breakfast was ok, toast came from a packet (pane tostato), there were cornetti (which were good) and bread (it was nice), yogurts, cereal, juice and coffee. I have to say the coffee wasn't very good. We had also asked for a room not overlooking the street. There was no noise as the windows were double glazed (and I'm person who lives in a quiet area, so I'm not used to a lot of noises). The furniture was good, nothing out of the ordinary. The room was pleasant enough. The checkout was a bit early, at 10 a.m. but at least we left our luggage at the hotel. The area may not have the charm of other places, but it was ok. There are a lot of hotels and restaurants and I felt quite safe. Also the location was good regards transportation (2 min from Termini), the hub of the metro, trains and buses. This was my 2nd time in Rome, and the 1st time I stayed at the Orlanda, and I can say that I would stay again. It was a great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly best of the best for the price!”
Reviews.Author: romeinlove
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the 2 star category. Clean, very friendly and perfect location. It has everything you need for comfortable and cheep stay in Rome. It is close to everything you need to see by foot or bus. The owner of the hotel Marco will go beyond to make your stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “....there are better places/ worst breakfast in my life”
Reviews.Author: 31man
Reviews.Content: our stay was a few years ago....so some things may have changed.. hopefuly breakfast... which was 2 tiny slices of burnt bread with jam and a shot !!!! of orange juice. We didn't bother with it after the first day room was nice and clean, but forget quiet sleep if you get a room on the street side. Cars , motorbikes, trams, shouts just outside the window!!! for the money they charge ... you could find better!!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: valencia2001
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located two blocks from the Termini railroad station (few minutes walk). This allows a quick access to the Rome subway, bus and train systems. Although the surroundings were very chaotic at any time of the day and the night the hotel room was very quite (providing that the window stay closed). The room was spacious for four people, clean with all the necessary amenities. The air conditioning was available at a cost of 10 Euros per day (well worth it). The staff was very professional, proficient in English, helpful and knowledgeable. The breakfast took place in a small room however we never felt crammed due to a well managed reservation system. The lady serving breakfast (unfortunately do not recall her name) was very accommodating. There were several restaurants in a short range and would recommend the "IL CONDOR" restaurant in Via D. Manin that provided good service and quality food at a reasonable cost (considering that you are in Rome).

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: mufctraveller
Reviews.Content: i stayed in here in april 2007 our room excellent and very clean,also its in a great location 2 mins walk to the train station and the taxi rank, the breakfast wasnt up to much i must admit ,but theres plenty of eatting places nearby so plenty of choice , im visiting this hotel again on dec12th 2007 for a night to watch the mighty reds of manchester.

Reviews.Title: “Nice size room, not the best area”
Reviews.Author: debbiejoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Rome for the first time at the Orlanda hotel. Nice size room and clean but I didn't like the area especially since it was our first time in Rome. Only two people could fit in the elevator and we were on the third floor. Breakfast wasn't much. Convenient to the Termini.

Reviews.Title: “too noisy”
Reviews.Author: martinlorentzen5
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Orlanda hotel in Rome with close relation to the railway station, which is advantageous when leaving early in the morning. The rooms were clean and well-equipped but the lighting a bit dull. We had to move in the middle of our stay (4 days) as the room had been booked at the same time by other guests (so we were told!). The new room was a small double bedroom, the manager told us, but in fact a single room with an extra bed with a very small passage between the beds. Much traffic noise, especialy in the first room (nr. 505). We got an allowance. We would choose another hotel when going to Rome next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ..Will go back!”
Reviews.Author: philosykos
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome! My friend and I spent 4 nights at the Orlanda Hotel near the train station area....We were totally pleased with the Hotel!First of all, the area did not bother us..its near the train station.All train station areas look the same and can be a bit dreary..but we felt safe and never had any problem or fears...so many people around ...full of life..places to eat etc.The train station has a small mall of shops in its downstairs area plus a 24 hour supermarket which was great for picking up foods or drinks. The Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.Our room was clean..spacious..and well decorated.We were surprised at how nice it was! A sat tv...telephone...safe...bathroom was perfect with new fixtures..hairdryer..I think the room was excellent for the price!Brealfast was included which was in a very quaint breakfast room area..fresh rolls,croissants(delicious)..butter,jam.cheese,coffee...espresso..corn flakes and milk..etc.Plus all you can eat!We loved our breakfast! We found this Hotel to be in a great location..near transport and other sights in walking distance...A shuttle bus service is available upon booking for 14 euros a person..this was great! Next time in Rome..thats where we will stay! Great price! 70 Euros for a double...breakfast and all included.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a 2*”
Reviews.Author: Claire275
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and good value for the price, however does have a few negative points. It is not so close to the historical centre. Probably around 30-40 mins walking or 2-3 stops on the metro. On the other hand, it is good however as it is just around the corner from Termini (main rail station) where you can pick up trains/buses/taxis/metro etc. We stayed in room 304, which i think was a bad example as it overlooked a main road and was noisey with cars beeping all through the night. Other rooms seemed to be further away from the main road, so i assume less noisey. Breakfast was average at best, and a time had to be booked in advance the night before. We were turned away once as the tiny breakfast room was already full. Overall, the hotel was not bad and the staff friendly. I suppose it was as good as you can expect from a 2* hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Rome from Hotel Orlanda”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly1881
Reviews.Content: I booked all the hotels for a trip to Italy with my boyfriend. This hotel was very clean and spacious at a good price. We arrived around 10am in the morning from the airport, they greeted us and offered us coffee while we waited about 15 minutes for our room to be ready. I was very happy that we were able to check in to our room early. The staff was very nice and helpful. Also, we enjoyed the breakfast with a coffee machine you can choose a variety of coffees and croissants, toast, cereal, etc. My boyfriend really enjoyed the hotel. The only downside is that we stayed on the 5th floor which was a hike with our suitcases. If you climb the dome at St. Peter's the last thing you want to see when you get to your hotel is more stairs. LOL. I requested room 506 based on a recommendation from a book, which I can no longer remember the title. The train station is nearby, which is great if you take the train from the airport. Also, both metro lines connect at the train station so this hotel is very accessible to anywhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: MJ53
Reviews.Content: The price for a room is very good by Rome standards and you get a very clean hotel with all the facilities a tourist needs. Location is fantastic, just about all the sights are within walking distance and all tourist buses arrive and depart from the Termini - about 5 minutes walk away. The friendly staff all speak good English and are pleased to advise how to plan your trips around their beautiful city. To really enjoy your stay try and get a courtyard facing room because like all Rome's hotels the traffic noise is ever present. If going in summer the extra €5 for aircon is worth the money if you cannot sleep with the noise from the open window. There is no restaurant but one excellent place to eat is Il Secchio Turn Right about 100 metres on first corner, it deserves all the praise it gets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: fanofpanic
Reviews.Content: I won't give it excellent because the breakfast could be a bit better (I am used to coffee and maybe toast, but this breakfast was even more inferior). However, when you weigh the fact that the hotel is half if not more than the price of other hotels in Rome and the rooms are double the size with AC, TV (in Italian, but you're in Italy, after all) very very clean and close to Termini, then you quickly forget the breakfast issue. It seems the hotel is actually is on a couple of different floors, but the reception is always staffed and they are very nice. The lift is a bit old (word of advice, you should never take an lift in Italy in the first place) and the area a bit shall we say lively but never threatening...at least there's always a spot to eat or drink at any time of the day. What do you expect a few hundred metres from the main railway station? I would highly recommend this hotel for its value friendliness and overall comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KatetSeb
Reviews.Content: We went to Hotel Orlanda for 5 days in May 2005. The location is excellent, very close to Termini metro and bus station which is great when you come to your hotel for a shower before eating and want to go to Trastevere for exemple! I would recommend this hotel. If possible check with the staff if you can book a room facing the inner court. The staff is very friendly and speak English

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Orlanda and the Happy Travelers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Tripadvisor, after much research we selected the Hotel Orlanda for a four night stay in Rome. It was a very warm late June 2004 and for starters the Orlanda had excellent air-conditioning in the rooms! Quite a relief after a day on the town. Back to the beginning, You have to look to find the sign that directs you to the hotel. The usual cramped elevator lifts you to the unassuming entrance. In the small tidy lobby, A young, (as was all of the desk staff) very friendly, english fluent desk attendant checked us in, offering maps and orientation. The rooms (we stayed in two as we returned to the hotel at the end of our trip) would qualify as basic, but were very clean and actually good sized. The mattresses could use a slight upgrade, if one had to find something not quite right. It seems like all the money has gone into the bathrooms which had marble floors, plenty of towels, plenty of hot water, hair dryer and were quite large by European standards. Of course, the view out the window was of the adjoining building and was only picturesque in the laundry on the line with kids playing in Italy kinda way. But we're not in Rome to sit in our hotel! So perhaps the Orlanda's true value is its proximity to the Termini. The subway and any bus to anywhere in the city is only three minutes away, As are trains to anywhere in Europe. Close but not too close as you don't really hear the train activity. (of course, you do have the air-conditioning on. Did I mention it is remote controlled? Just like a tv remote). Once you get the hang of the Metro and buses much of Rome is easily at your command. Location, location, location. There are restaurants in the neighborhood of adequate quality and the streets a bit busy for sidewalk dining, although we did anyway, but remember you're only minutes from transportation to anywhere you want to go and the nice person at the desk will tell you how to get there. Also there is gelato right next door, which, it turns out, is important in summer. One other mention, the hotel breakfast was simple, but fine to start your day and the coffee in the automatic dispenser was actually the best I'd had in years! I'm serious. I don't know what the secret is, but that darn machine did a better cup then a U.S. Starbucks or any other pretender. It reminded me just how good it is to be back in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “The worst I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler01
Reviews.Content: What a seedy hotel, location and unfriendly staff. Don't stay in this area of Rome (the few streets near Termini station). It is full of litter, gypseys and vagrants. We felt unsafe and the locked gate for this hotel is full of litter even inside the gate. It looked like a third world ghetto. I have been to Rome about 10 times and this is the worst area I have experienced. Stay anywhere else. We asked if we could get the room priced without breakfast since we had an early morning flight (before they served) and the desk clerk laughed hysterically for 2 minutes...we wondered if he was on drugs. The next morning when we left and we checked out, he smelled really bad. The price was 108 Euro but it should have been more like 50 Euro. At the airport the next day, we heard from other people that they had stayed in this area and felt the same way.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location!”
Reviews.Author: Inhabitant
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome from 21 april until 24 april. Hotel Orlanda is in the centre of Rome. Only 2 min. walk to Termini station where the metro/bus/trains are and only 15 min. walk tot Colosseum/Forum Romanum. It is in one building (3 and 5 floor) with several other hotels. The room was good and clean. Be aware of noise from out side. It is not a country side. But never the less we slept good. Good bathroom and a great shower! A safety deposit box is in the room. The breakfastroom is small, but you reserve the day before a time (at the receptiondesk) and than it is fine. Breakfast was good, several sweet cakes, some bread and crackers. Cornflakes with milk and off course serveral kinds of coffee. The staff was very friendly, helpfull and give good information. Wireless internet and laptop is available (3 euro p. hour). Shuttle bus is available (12 euro p.p) from the hotel to the Airport. But the terravision bus (to Ciampino airport) and the leonardo express (to Fiumicino airport) go from Termini. Hotel Orlanda is a very good hotel, well above 2 stars! We would recommend this hotel to everyone. If we would return to Rome than we would def. go back to Hotel Orlanda!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, roomy, safe, close”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed four nights in a quadruple room of Hotel Orlanda in Novmber 2004. We made a reservation online through Orbitz and paid when checking out (108 Euros per night -- No hidden charge at all). The room had a queen-size bed and two twin beds with a cleanly washed, odorless, cozy bedding (They changed the bedding every morning). The beige-marble-floored room was very roomy, equipped with a personal air conditioner (cool or hot). We appreciated the blue color of curtains, two framed classic pictures, the small refrigerator, the safe box, and the clean, remodeled bathroom with a cute bidet and a plenty of hot water supply. The television was small (17 inches maybe), but it had many channels (no adult channel, which was good for parents with children). The all-you-can-eat breackfast with milk, bread, cereal, cheese, orange juice, and 20-some different kinds of coffee was free and of very decent quality. The serving ladies were kind. The breakfast room was also very clean and classic. The staff in the front didn't usually smile, but were very professional, informative, industrious, and responsive. They gave us very helpful tips and free maps for tours. According to our request by email, they arranged a taxi from the airport (we paid 47 Euros). We liked the Mercedes-Benz taxi. So, we used the taxi service again back to the airport. The location of Orlanda was close to major tour sites (20-minute pleasant walk to Colloceum, Capitol, Roman Forum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and luxury shopping streets). For further places such as Vatican and the Mouth of Truth, we rode a bus or subway (one Euro per ride): the Termini is two blocks away. The location of Orlanda was very safe. Non-hotel residents had no way to come into the hotel without passing the staff's checking. Even in the midnight, the street was crowded with people (mostly, tourists in the neighboring hotels). The street was always lively. The only thing that bothered us a little bit was the noise of traffic, but as long as you want to stay inside Rome, you should bear with it. We strongly recommend you Hotel Orlanda.

Reviews.Title: “Problems with Orlanda Hotel”
Reviews.Author: natale
Reviews.Content: My friend and myself stayed at the Hotel Orlanda in September 2004. My daughter made the booking with the hotel in May giving her credit card details (as my friend and myself do not have credit card's). When we arrived we saw the lift only accommodates 1 person and a suitcase (also the lift was very old) so we decided to walk up the 4 flights of stairs (luggage included) to the hotel. We was given a cold welcome and given the keys to our rooms. The rooms were clean and adequate (for our 1 night stay). Next morning we had to go up to another hotel which was in the same building for breakfast, the breakfast was very nice. When we checked out we were told by a member of staff we had to pay for our nights stay. We explained that the rooms and payment had been payed for in May by my daughter with her credit card. We were told the credit card details my daughter gave only 'secures' the rooms and no payment is taken out. We both had to pay the bill useing our spending money. Luckly when we arrived back home and no money had been taken out of my daughters account to pay for the hotel. I cannot understand as to why the hotel does not explain this when asking for credit card details. I dont think we will be staying at the Orlanda again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied with the Orlanda”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Orlanda for 5 nights during a trip around Europe last fall. For us, with our heavy backpacks, it's location just around the corner from the train station was perfect. However, it was quite a walk to any sites of interest. Our room was always spotless and, by European standards, very large. The room looked as though it had been recently renovated and the photos on the hotel website are very accurate. After a long day, the hike up the many flights of stairs to the hotel was exhausting. (There was an elevator, but one look at it convinced us never to get inside.) The breakfast was very disappointing, but at least you could eat as much as you wanted. Both the coffee and orange juice came out of a machine and one morning, I ate what I am sure was the world's worst tasting croissant. (Although the staff were generally helpful and nice, the woman who worked in the breakfast room was always miserable.)

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: totoroec
Reviews.Content: We like it because it is very close to Termini, convenient, easy to find restaurants, internet service, laundry... the street is very noisy though... the room is clean and large comparing to other european hotels in its class... they have A/C in the room but you need to pay $5 to use it... the staff is friendly, youthful and helpful. We would go back to this hotel if we go to Rome again...

Reviews.Title: “living in the city...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised to read all the good remarks about the hotel.Yes the rooms are clean and spacious but;1.there is a horrible noise during the night coming from the street which makes sleeping impossible,the windows do not prevent it and it's a big problem especially when the Roman Tram comes. 2. It's hard to find the hotel ,there is no sign outside the building and hotel itslef is only a part of many other hotels inside the same building and it takes only few floors. 3.the corridor is bleak and the elevator looks as though it was taken from the belle epoque which could have been good had it not been slowly and small. yes the rooms are nice but it doesn't worth the prices they take.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there March 9 & 10 2004. They have recently renovated the rooms. It is very close to the main train station (Roma Termini) so you can catch a train, subway or bus to anywhere. The staff speaks fluent English and was very friendly, honest and helpful. They recommended a nice restaurant that was close and reasonably priced (Gallena Bianca). It was a nice restaurant 2 blocks from hotel. We enjoyed our meal.For the price this is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “a gem”
Reviews.Author: CherylKDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: The room was great. Large by European standards. We had a private bath (tiny shower) and bring your own wash cloths. The breakfast isn't much but there's a fabulous little coffee shop (bar) downstairs. The staff was friendly & very helpful. They directed us to several great restaurants & set us up for an overnight stay in Sorrento at another great place. We were there for almost 2 weeks and loved the central location 2 blocks from the Termini (train) Station. Neither of us spoke Italian but everyone was kind & helpful. We were there the end of May & the weather was perfect. We want to go back & Hotel Orlanda is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel!! It is located close to Rome's train station, it was very convenient to find. Located in lovely old building. Staying there in late June 2003 during their oppressive heatwave!! (loved it nonetheless!). The rooms were really large and spacious, and very clean, with two YES two bathrooms located across the hall from us which were always spotless. The room rates were very reasonable as well. The breakfast was very nice consisting of pastries, rolls, cereals, juices, coffee, with a very nice breakfast host. It was very convenient to walk or take a train or bus to any of Rome's main attractions from this hotel, such as the Forum, Coliseum, Vatican, musuems, restaurants. Rome is a very friendly public transportation city, but very large place to navigate!! My favorite place in Italy, would go back in a heartbeat.
